meanings.definition: In a redundant or repetitive manner.
meanings.sent1: She tautologously repeated the same instructions over and over again.
meanings.sent2: He spoke tautologously, saying the same thing multiple times in a row.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tautologously mimicked the sound of the doorbell all day long.
meanings.sent4: The ticking clock tautologously reminded her of the passing time.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet tautologously echoed through the empty house.

meanings.definition: Using unnecessary repetition in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: His tautologously long essay was filled with unnecessary words.
meanings.sent2: The tautologously written report kept repeating the same information.
meanings.sent3: The tautologously decorated cake had layers upon layers of frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her tautologously detailed explanation bored the audience.
meanings.sent5: The tautologously patterned wallpaper made the room feel cramped.
